text: [Music]
there are 196 countries in the world
today and virtually none of them have
purple on their national flag throughout
history purple was never used to
represent a kingdom civilization or
Empire so what's wrong with purple it's
such a popular color today why would no
country use it in their
flag the answer is really quite simple
purple was just far too expensive no
countries have purple on their flag
because up until the 1800s purple was
worth more than its weight in gold The
Color Purple has been associated with
royalty power and wealth for centuries
in fact Queen Elizabeth the forbade
anyone except close members of the royal
family to wear it purple's Elite status
stems from the Rarity and cost of the Dy
originally used to produce it the diey
initially used to make purple came from
The Phoenician trading city of Ty which
is now in modern-day Lebanon fabric
Traders obtained the Dy from a small sea
snail that was only found in the tire
region of the
Mediterranean a lot of work went into
producing the dye as more than 10,000
snails were needed to create just one
gram of tyrian purple since only wealthy
rulers could afford to buy and wear the
color it became associated with the
Imperial classes of of Rome Egypt and
Persia purple also came to represent
spirituality and Holiness because the
ancient Emperors kings and queens that
wore the color were often thought of as
gods or descendants of the
Gods sometimes however the DI is too
expensive even for
royalty 3rd Century Roman Emperor aelian
famously wouldn't allow his wife to buy
a Shaw made from tyri and purple silk
because it literally cost three times
its weight in gold
a single pound of dye cost 3 lb of gold
which is the equivalent of
today so since the sheer price of purple
was so astronomically high no one not
even the richest Nations could afford to
have purple on their flag the Hue became
more accessible to lower classes about a
century and a half ago in 1856
18-year-old English chemist William
Henry Perkin accidentally created a
synthetic purple compound compound while
attempting to synthesize quinine an
antimalaria drug he noticed that the
compound could be used to die Fabrics so
he patented the dye manufactured it and
got Filthy
Rich purple dye was then mass produced
so just about everybody could afford it
the elite stopped valuing purple and the
status symbol faded away but the country
flags remain the same since 1900 a
handful of new national flags have been
designed and a few of them have opted to
use purple in their flag so don't be
making any bets just yet hopefully you
found this interesting sometimes the
simplest questions have the most
fascinating
answers for more interesting videos like
this one please subscribe
[Music]
